cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northwest tonight, then north-northeast on Wednesday, crossing Florida’s Big Bend and lifting NE up the southeast U.S. coast toward the Atlantic offshore of the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina coasts including Cape Fear and the Outer Banks
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Friday as the center passes nearby
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along the southern North Carolina coast, including the Cape Fear River entrance
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause ponding and minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and short-lived waterspouts near the coast
